story:
Introducing PureWrist! 

Fashionable WristWear That Allows You To Make SECURE Contactless Payment Transactions and Simultaneously Give Back Each Day! 

Familiar Done Differently


For more visit us at www.purewrist.com 

PureWrist is innovative.  It is a fashionable SECURE contactless payment bracelet. Now you can LEAVE YOUR WALLET behind and 'Tap to Pay' with your bracelet that contains a Prepaid Card offering contactless payment functionality.  The name of the card is the Gratitude PrePaid MasterCard ®.


The bracelet is made with a very soft luxury silicone that is very comfortable on the wrist and feels great.


Pay ALL OVER THE WORLD where MasterCard Debit contactless payments are accepted. 

The USA is responsible for roughly 50% the amount of fraud compared to the rest of the world.  This is according to Nielsen BI(http://www.businessinsider.com/the-us-accounts-for-over-half-of-global-payment-card-fraud-sai-2014-3#ixzz35NsFW55d).

Learn more details about PureWrist in the campaign page below. 
Be the first and get yours at a special IngieGoGo price. 
After the campaign the standard prices will increase.


Our Mission: Enhancing advocacy with innovative payment solutions



PureWrist gave $1,171.47 this campaign to The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society. It averages out to $6.13/person.  Our projections indicate that roughly 40 cents per month from the subscription will be donated to LLS for Gratitude account holders that continue to use PureWrist and keep Gratitude activated. PureWrist will continue to add more non profits after the IndieGogo campaign. Users will be able to pick their charity of choice in the future.

PureWrist 

PureWrist integrates a reloadable prepaid MasterCard that is manufactured into a small mini form with a cutting edge antenna and securely inserted into your PureWrist bracelet.  

The mini card with special antenna is personalized, activation ready, and inserted into your bracelet before you receive the product.

The mini card adheres to extremely strict international regulatory standards validating a defined set of electrical, mechanical, and communication protocol characteristics.  




The card in the bracelet IS NOT A CREDIT CARD!

It is a reloadable prepaid MasterCard!

Because this is a prepaid card there is NO CREDIT APPROVAL NEEDED!



The account is SECURE.  

The online account dashboard has SSL encryption for extra security on the web. Each account has a personal pin attached to prevent fraud.  

Funds loaded on to your Gratitude card are FDIC insured through Sunrise Banks, NA.. Therefore, if you lose your bracelet the funds are protected.  Simply notify customer support and your account will be blocked.  

You are able to easily load funds by connecting your bracelet account to a bank account or even your PayPal account.  



After PureWrist waives your first month subscription fee when the card is activated, there is a very small meaningful subscription fee of $4.99/mo. This will continue to keep the system personalized and activated. Our projections indicate that roughly 40 cents per month from the subscription will be donated to LLS for Gratitude card holders that continue to use PureWrist and keep Gratitude activated. This means that when you are paying the subscription fee you are helping support PureWrist revenues.  In turn PureWrist will be giving some of the subscription fee to charity. Not a lot, but just a little, at the end of the day everything adds up. 

You can opt out of this subscription fee at any time and the account will be closed and a check will be mailed for the remaining balance. When this happens the bracelet will loose it's payment functionality.  

No searching through your bag, pockets, or wallet. No pressing buttons or using an app. Keep it simple with a tap of your wrist!

The PureWrist bracelets and cards are water resistant.



No compromise: It Just Makes Sense

Your continued use of PureWrist as a way to pay enables PureWrist to  give back to charity.

PureWrist is great for those who live an active lifestyle. Runners, skateboarders, surfers, and bikers!


PureWrist is water resistant!  So you can shower or jump in the water with it on.


Out for that beautiful morning or afternoon run?  Bike ride? Walk?


Going to the beach?


On the go during the day at the office?

These are just a few of the many scenarios where your PureWrist bracelet can be enjoyed.

PureWrist is designed to be worn on its own or easily stacked with other wristwear to enhance your sense of style.

For those who live in Chicago or Philadelphia metropolitan areas you are able to use PureWrist to pay-as-you-go for rides on those transit systems where ever you see contactless payment symbols.  



The Kathryn



Product Description
This model is named in memory of a dear friend of the founders who passed away from cancer. She cherished life and lived it to the fullest

“When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love … Don’t count the days, make the days count.”

Strap Material
Luxury grade silicone with a protective coating

Color
Black

Length
Universal size 7.1 in (180mm) adjustable
Fits the average to smaller wrist size 

Clasp Hardware
316 high grade black nickel steel

Chip Pocket
Customized to secure the card

Shipping and Subscription
Complimentary shipping and first month subscription fee waived.

To keep the card activated there is a $4.99 monthly subscription fee.  This small fee enables you to keep the card as a payment mechanism.  It will be automatically charged one month after card activation.  If you choose to not continue and subscribe, the payment mechanism will not function.  You can close your card at anytime and the remaining funds in your account will be mailed to you via check, the bracelet is yours to keep.




The Jerome


Product Description
This model is named after an inspirational friend of the founders who made an impact on the communities he served by always giving to charity. He put others before himself and left a powerful mark. We honor him with the production of this style.

“What we have done for ourselves alone dies with us, what we have done for others and the world remains and is immortal.”

Strap Material
Luxury grade silicone with a protective coating that easily wraps around the wrist twice for ultra comfort. A double wrap fashion style

Color
Black

Length
Medium: 16.8 in (42.8cm) easily adjustable
Fits the average to smaller wrist
Large: 15.6 in (39.6cm) easily adjustable
Fits the larger wrist

Clasp Hardware
316 high grade black nickel steel snap buckles.  All buckles are engraved.

Chip Pocket
Customized to secure the card

Shipping and Subscription
Complimentary Shipping and first month subscription fee waived.  

To keep the card activated there is a $4.99 monthly subscription.  This small fee enables you to keep the card as a payment mechanism.  It will be automatically charged one month after card activation.  If you choose to not continue and subscribe, the payment mechanism will not function.  You can close your card at anytime and the remaining funds in your account will be mailed to you via check, the bracelet is yours to keep.


Inspired and committed to greatness, PureWrist is a private company that was born with the entrepreneurial and emotional spirit.  We believe in making an impact and giving back.  Close to our heart is philanthropy based on the Co-Founder having a personal experience with cancer and surviving it 3 times.  For that we are grateful to Leukemia & Lymphoma Society and their incredible breakthroughs in blood cancer research.



We have a diverse team of reliable and trusted vendors in secure card manufacture, payments, banking, design, accessories manufacture, and marketing.

Our video was produced by the amazing group at CLICKON Media, a NYC and London based fully integrated production company.

The team at PureWrist holds close to their mission that it must uphold a responsibility to it's users and charities by maintaining a system with integrity.



Over the course of the research and development phases we have experienced incredible discoveries, breakthroughs, and experiences.

We have dedicated personal financial resources and thousands of hours to this process that has spanned over 4 years to create the ecosystem that enables PureWrist to function and transact in a highly regulated environment.

We have been through the prototyping and design process.

Prototypes


We have been through a diligent process to identify all the key players that make the PureWrist experience stable, differentiated, and unique.



We Chose Indiegogo because of all the amazing supporters out there on IndieGogo enable the dreams of entrepreneurs to come true.


TODAY your help and support will enable us to manufacture the first bulk production run of the PureWrist and card products, it will allow us to create new styles featuring different colors and designs, as well as enable us to start the mobile application development process to enhance the PureWrist system even more.


Unleash the power of community as we move boldly into the future.  

Thank you so much.

- Team PureWrist

When you back PureWrist we are offering these amazing perks! 


Check out the PureWrist Active Wear Shirt: 


The PureWrist products will be available after the campaign for $49.  Make sure you take advantage of the exclusive IndieGogo specials! 


Risks & Challenges

All PureWrist products displayed were put together by suppliers who will supply bulk production. We’re currently gearing up the manufactures and are ready to meet the estimated delivery times.  We are anticipating the system and product will be ready for September delivery.  

Forecasting Risk

We’ve done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid plan. We’ve learned a lot from listening to some of the key players in accessory manufacture, card manufacture, secure fulfillment, and banking, but sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark. 

Supply Chain Risk

We’ve built an ecosystem of capable suppliers who have collectively produced and shipped millions of units. However, component delays and unexpected shortages can occur. If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work to quickly solve the problem.



UNITED STATES PAYMENT SYSTEMS GENERAL FAQ:

*This is simple information and how it relates to acceptance of the PureWrist and Your card account

**EMV is a registered trademark in the U.S. and other countries and an unregistered trademark elsewhere. The EMV trademark is owned by EMVCo.

October 1, 2015: A Date to Remember

Starting on October 1, the liability for fraudulent, in-person payments will begin to shift to the merchant from a Bank. If an EMV card is used in a transaction at a business that does not accept chip and pin payments the merchant can be liable for the transaction.

Because of Association liability rule shifts going into place on October 1st, it’s anticipated that more merchants will begin using CONTACTLY/NFC ready terminals.


What Is EMV?

EMV is a global payment system that entails putting a microprocessor chip into cards, making them less vulnerable to fraud for in-person transactions. Because EMV uses better data security, this standard is being adopted in the United States. In addition, many debit and credit cards will be reissued to their holders with EMV chips by October 2015 and into 2016. EMV systems are already in use all over the world and growing more and more popular.  

What are Contactless Payments?

Contactless payments are completed by a “tap” to the checkout terminal instead of a “swipe” of the card. This card with special antenna is inserted into our designed and secure pocket on the PureWrist bracelet.  It’s so seamless that you can’t even tell from the naked eye there is a payment enabled device.  We tried to keep it as design and fashion focused as possible.  This small contactless enabled card communicates with the terminal just like a regular shaped contactless enabled card.


General FAQ:

Will you ship internationally?

No, Only shipping to the USA.  

Criteria to sign up for account?

In order to sign up for the Gratitude Contactless Prepaid MasterCard, you will need to verify your identity.**

What are shipping fees?

PureWrist pays for shipping.  No shipping cost.

Is the subscription the only fee?

There are no other fees that are charged for using  the card.  The user is responsible for lost or stolen replacements.  There is a cardholder agreement that includes all conditions that comes with the card.  There are international fees if you use your card across the world just a like any other credit debit card. The full list of fees are outlined in the Terms and Conditions, which would be provided prior to account opening.

Can I cancel my Subscription Fee?

The Subscription Fee is required in order to use the Gratitude Prepaid MasterCard. If you opt out of paying the subscription fee, your account will be closed, and remaining funds on your card will be returned to you via check. The bracelet is yours to keep.


Charity Affiliation:

How is PureWrist affiliated with charity?

PureWrist has built into its mission to fund charity and increase overall advocacy by the continued use of the card  as a Meaningful Way to Pay. The first charity being Leukemia & Lymphoma Society.

How does PureWrist track this?

When receiving your PureWrist bracelet each user will be connected to a charity in our database and this provides a seamless way to track usage in our system and make sure that that charity receives their donation at the end of the month.  

How does PureWrist fund charity?

Our projections indicate that roughly 40 cents per month from the subscription will be donated to LLS for Gratitude account holders that continue to use PureWrist and keep Gratitude activated. This means that when you are paying the subscription you are helping support PureWrist revenues.  In turn PureWrist will be giving some of the subscription fee to charity. Not a lot, but just a little, at the end of the day everything adds up. 

How can I trust PureWrist is adhering to a high standard?

PureWrist prides itself on integrity that is set forth by it’s founders.  PureWrist vets each charity that it gives to and ensures that they are operating as a 501c3 not for profit business.  Only trusted charities that have integrity will be part of the PureWrist ecosystem.  PureWrist works with certified accounting professionals to make sure giving is done properly.  Charities that PureWrist works with are accredited and meet standards ofhttp://www.give.org/ a Better Business Bureau Alliance that vets charities.   

Each charity also goes through a diligence review at the issuing bank, Sunrise Banks, N.A.


Warranty:

PureWrist Warranty

We stand by our products. That's why we guarantee them from material and workmanship defects for 60 days from the original date of purchase.  Warranty does not cover natural wear and tear, user abuse, or any chemical damages (oils, liquids, or the like).  This is referring to the bracelet itself there are no warranties associated with card transactions.

Terms and Conditions/Privacy Policy

Our privacy policy is available at: http://purewrist.com/privacy-policy/

Our terms and conditions are available at: http://purewrist.com/terms-conditions/

*All trademarks and service marks on this page are the properties of their respective owners

Contact Us for additional questions at anytime.

All inquiries: welcome@purewrist.com


**The USA PATRIOT Act is a federal law that requires all financial institutions to obtain, verify and record information that identifies each person who opens a Card Account. What this means for you: When you open a Card Account, we will ask for your name, address, date of birth and other information that will allow us to reasonably identify you. We may also ask to see your driver's license or other identifying documents at any time.

*Gratitude™ Contactless PrePaid MasterCard® is issued by Sunrise Banks N.A., St. Paul, MN 55103, Member FDIC, pursuant to a license from MasterCard.  Use of this card constitutes acceptance of the terms and conditions stated in the Cardholder Agreement. 

PureWrist™  is an Independent Sales Organization (ISO) and is a registered agent of Sunrise Banks, N. A.
story_txt:
Introducing PureWrist! 
Fashionable WristWear That Allows You To Make SECURE Contactless Payment Transactions and Simultaneously Give Back Each Day! 

Familiar Done Differently

For more visit us at www.purewrist.com 



PureWrist is innovative.  It is a fashionable SECURE contactless payment bracelet. Now you can LEAVE YOUR WALLET behind and 'Tap to Pay' with your bracelet that contains a Prepaid Card offering contactless payment functionality.  The name of the card is the Gratitude PrePaid MasterCard ®.

The bracelet is made with a very soft luxury silicone that is very comfortable on the wrist and feels great.



Pay ALL OVER THE WORLD where MasterCard Debit contactless payments are accepted. 
The USA is responsible for roughly 50% the amount of fraud compared to the rest of the world.  This is according to Nielsen BI(http://www.businessinsider.com/the-us-accounts-for-over-half-of-global-payment-card-fraud-sai-2014-3#ixzz35NsFW55d).


Learn more details about PureWrist in the campaign page below. 

Be the first and get yours at a special IngieGoGo price. 

After the campaign the standard prices will increase.



Our Mission: Enhancing advocacy with innovative payment solutions



PureWrist
gave $1,171.47 this campaign to The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society. It
averages out to $6.13/person.  Our
projections indicate that roughly 40 cents per month from the subscription will
be donated to LLS for Gratitude account holders that continue to use PureWrist
and keep Gratitude activated. PureWrist will continue to add more non
profits after the IndieGogo campaign. Users will be able to pick their charity
of choice in the future.

PureWrist 
PureWrist integrates a reloadable prepaid MasterCard that is manufactured into a small mini form with a cutting edge antenna and securely inserted into your PureWrist bracelet.  
The mini card with special antenna is personalized, activation ready, and inserted into your bracelet before you receive the product.


The mini card adheres to extremely strict international regulatory standards validating a defined set of electrical, mechanical, and communication protocol characteristics.  






The card in the bracelet IS NOT A CREDIT CARD!

It is a reloadable prepaid MasterCard!
Because this is a prepaid card there is NO CREDIT APPROVAL NEEDED!


The account is SECURE.  
The online account dashboard has SSL encryption for extra security on the web. Each account has a personal pin attached to prevent fraud.  

Funds loaded on to your Gratitude card are FDIC
insured through Sunrise Banks, NA.. Therefore, if you lose your bracelet the funds are protected.  Simply notify customer support and your account will be blocked.  
You are able to easily load funds by connecting your bracelet account to a bank account or even your PayPal account.  




After PureWrist waives your first month subscription fee when the card is activated, there is a very small meaningful subscription fee of $4.99/mo. This will continue to keep the system personalized and activated. Our projections indicate that roughly 40 cents per month from the subscription will be donated to LLS for Gratitude card holders that continue to use PureWrist and keep Gratitude activated. This means that when you are paying the subscription fee you are helping support PureWrist revenues.  In turn PureWrist will be giving some of the subscription fee to charity. Not a lot, but just a little, at the end of the day everything adds up. 
You can opt out of this subscription fee at any time and the account will be closed and a check will be mailed for the remaining balance. When this happens the bracelet will loose it's payment functionality.  





No searching through your bag, pockets, or wallet. No pressing buttons or using an app. Keep it simple with a tap of your wrist!
The PureWrist bracelets and cards are water resistant.




No compromise: It Just Makes Sense
Your continued use of PureWrist as a way to pay enables PureWrist to  give back to charity.
PureWrist is great for those who live an active lifestyle. Runners, skateboarders, surfers, and bikers!



PureWrist is water resistant!  So you can shower or jump in the water with it on.




Out for that beautiful morning or afternoon run?  Bike ride? Walk?




Going to the beach?




On the go during the day at the office?
These are just a few of the many scenarios where your PureWrist bracelet can be enjoyed.
PureWrist is designed to be worn on its own or easily stacked with other wristwear to enhance your sense of style.
For those who live in Chicago or Philadelphia metropolitan areas you are able to use PureWrist to pay-as-you-go for rides on those transit systems where ever you see contactless payment symbols.  




The Kathryn





Product DescriptionThis model is named in memory of a dear friend of the founders who passed away from cancer. She cherished life and lived it to the fullest
“When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love … Don’t count the days, make the days count.”

Strap MaterialLuxury grade silicone with a protective coating

ColorBlack

LengthUniversal size 7.1 in (180mm) adjustableFits the average to smaller wrist size 

Clasp Hardware316 high grade black nickel steel

Chip PocketCustomized to secure the card

Shipping and SubscriptionComplimentary shipping and first month subscription fee waived.
To keep
the card activated there is a $4.99 monthly subscription fee.  This small fee enables you to keep
the card as a payment mechanism.  It will
be automatically charged one month after card activation.  If you choose to not continue and subscribe, the payment mechanism will not function.  You can close your card at anytime and the remaining funds in your account will be mailed to you via check, the bracelet is yours to keep.








The Jerome




Product DescriptionThis model is named after an inspirational friend of the founders who made an impact on the communities he served by always giving to charity. He put others before himself and left a powerful mark. We honor him with the production of this style.
“What we have done for ourselves alone dies with us, what we have done for others and the world remains and is immortal.”

Strap MaterialLuxury grade silicone with a protective coating that easily wraps around the wrist twice for ultra comfort. A double wrap fashion style

ColorBlack

LengthMedium: 16.8 in (42.8cm) easily adjustableFits the average to smaller wristLarge: 15.6 in (39.6cm) easily adjustableFits the larger wrist

Clasp Hardware316 high grade black nickel steel snap buckles.  All buckles are engraved.

Chip PocketCustomized to secure the card

Shipping and SubscriptionComplimentary Shipping and first month subscription fee waived.  
To keep the card activated there is a $4.99 monthly subscription.  This small fee enables you to keep the card as a payment mechanism.  It will be automatically charged one month after card activation.  If you choose to not continue and subscribe, the payment mechanism will not function.  You can close your card at anytime and the remaining funds in your account will be mailed to you via check, the bracelet is yours to keep.




Inspired and committed to greatness, PureWrist is a private company that was born with the entrepreneurial and emotional spirit.  We believe in making an impact and giving back.  Close to our heart is philanthropy based on the Co-Founder having a personal experience with cancer and surviving it 3 times.  For that we are grateful to Leukemia & Lymphoma Society and their incredible breakthroughs in blood cancer research.





We have a diverse team of reliable and trusted vendors in secure card manufacture, payments, banking, design, accessories manufacture, and marketing.
Our video was produced by the amazing group at CLICKON Media, a NYC and London based fully integrated production company.
The team at PureWrist holds close to their mission that it must uphold a responsibility to it's users and charities by maintaining a system with integrity.




Over the course of the research and development phases we have experienced incredible discoveries, breakthroughs, and experiences.
We have dedicated personal financial resources and thousands of hours to this process that has spanned over 4 years to create the ecosystem that enables PureWrist to function and transact in a highly regulated environment. 
We have been through the prototyping and design process.

PrototypesWe have been through a diligent process to identify all the key players that make the PureWrist experience stable, differentiated, and unique.





We Chose Indiegogo because of all the amazing supporters out there on IndieGogo enable the dreams of entrepreneurs to come true.


TODAY your help and support will enable us to manufacture the first bulk production run of the PureWrist and card products, it will allow us to create new styles featuring different colors and designs, as well as enable us to start the mobile application development process to enhance the PureWrist system even more.


Unleash the power of community as we move boldly into the future.  
Thank you so much.
- Team PureWrist
When you back PureWrist we are offering these amazing perks! 

Check out the PureWrist Active Wear Shirt: 






The PureWrist products will be available after the campaign for $49.  Make sure you take advantage of the exclusive IndieGogo specials! 

Risks & Challenges

All PureWrist products displayed were put together by suppliers who will supply bulk production. We’re currently gearing up the manufactures and are ready to meet the estimated delivery times.  We are anticipating the system and product will be ready for September delivery.  
Forecasting Risk
We’ve done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid plan. We’ve learned a lot from listening to some of the key players in accessory manufacture, card manufacture, secure fulfillment, and banking, but sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark. 
Supply Chain Risk
We’ve built an ecosystem of capable suppliers who have collectively produced and shipped millions of units. However, component delays and unexpected shortages can occur. If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work to quickly solve the problem.



UNITED STATES PAYMENT SYSTEMS GENERAL FAQ:*This is simple information and how it relates to acceptance of the PureWrist and Your card account**EMV is a registered trademark in the U.S. and other countries and an unregistered trademark elsewhere. The EMV trademark is owned by EMVCo.October 1, 2015: A Date to RememberStarting on October 1, the liability for fraudulent, in-person payments will begin to shift to the merchant from a Bank. If an EMV card is used in a transaction at a business that does not accept chip and pin payments the merchant can be liable for the transaction.Because of Association liability rule shifts
going into place on October 1st, it’s anticipated that more
merchants will begin using CONTACTLY/NFC ready terminals.What Is EMV?EMV is a global payment system that entails putting a microprocessor chip into cards, making them less vulnerable to fraud for in-person transactions. Because EMV uses better data security, this standard is being adopted in the United States. In addition, many debit and credit cards will be reissued to their holders with EMV chips by October 2015 and into 2016. EMV systems are already in use all over the world and growing more and more popular.  What are Contactless Payments?Contactless payments are completed by a “tap” to the checkout terminal instead of a “swipe” of the card. This card with special antenna is inserted into our designed and secure pocket on the PureWrist bracelet.  It’s so seamless that you can’t even tell from the naked eye there is a payment enabled device.  We tried to keep it as design and fashion focused as possible.  This small contactless enabled card communicates with the terminal just like a regular shaped contactless enabled card.General FAQ:Will you ship internationally?No, Only shipping to the USA.  Criteria to sign up for account?


In order to sign up for the Gratitude
Contactless Prepaid MasterCard, you will need to verify your identity.**
What are shipping fees?
PureWrist pays for shipping.  No shipping cost.
Is the subscription the only fee?
There are no other fees that are charged for using  the card.  The user is responsible for lost or stolen replacements.  There is a cardholder agreement that includes all conditions that comes with the card.  There are international fees if you use your card across the world just a like any other credit debit card. The full list of fees are outlined in the Terms and Conditions, which would be provided prior to account opening.
Can I cancel my Subscription Fee?




The Subscription Fee is required in order to use the
Gratitude Prepaid MasterCard. If you opt out of paying the subscription fee, your account
will be closed, and remaining funds on your card will be returned to you via
check. The bracelet is yours to keep.






Charity Affiliation:
How is PureWrist affiliated with charity?
PureWrist has built into its mission to fund charity and increase overall advocacy by the continued use of the card  as a Meaningful Way to Pay. The first charity being Leukemia & Lymphoma Society.
How does PureWrist track this?
When receiving your PureWrist bracelet each user will be connected to a charity in our database and this provides a seamless way to track usage in our system and make sure that that charity receives their donation at the end of the month.  
How does PureWrist fund charity?




Our projections indicate that roughly 40 cents per month from the
subscription will be donated to LLS for Gratitude account holders that continue
to use PureWrist and keep Gratitude activated. This means that when you
are paying the subscription you are helping support PureWrist revenues. 
In turn PureWrist will be giving some of the subscription fee to charity. Not a
lot, but just a little, at the end of the day everything adds up. 
How can I trust PureWrist is adhering to a high standard?
PureWrist prides itself on integrity that is set forth by it’s founders.  PureWrist vets each charity that it gives to and ensures that they are operating as a 501c3 not for profit business.  Only trusted charities that have integrity will be part of the PureWrist ecosystem.  PureWrist works with certified accounting professionals to make sure giving is done properly.  Charities that PureWrist works with are accredited and meet standards ofhttp://www.give.org/ a Better Business Bureau Alliance that vets charities.   

Each charity also goes through a diligence
review at the issuing bank, Sunrise Banks, N.A.






Warranty:
PureWrist Warranty 
We stand by our products. That's why we guarantee them from material and workmanship defects for 60 days from the original date of purchase.  Warranty does not cover natural wear and tear, user abuse, or any chemical damages (oils, liquids, or the like).  This is referring to the bracelet itself there are no warranties associated with card transactions.

Terms and Conditions/Privacy Policy
Our privacy policy is available at: http://purewrist.com/privacy-policy/
Our terms and conditions are available at: http://purewrist.com/terms-conditions/
*All trademarks and service marks on this page are the properties of their respective owners
Contact Us for additional questions at anytime.
All inquiries: welcome@purewrist.com



**The USA PATRIOT Act is a federal law that requires all financial institutions to obtain, verify and record information that identifies each person who opens a Card Account. What this means for you: When you open a Card Account, we will ask for your name, address, date of birth and other information that will allow us to reasonably identify you. We may also ask to see your driver's license or other identifying documents at any time.
*Gratitude™ Contactless PrePaid MasterCard® is issued by Sunrise
Banks N.A., St. Paul, MN 55103, Member FDIC, pursuant to a license from
MasterCard.  Use of this card constitutes acceptance of
the terms and conditions stated in the Cardholder Agreement. 
PureWrist™  is an Independent Sales Organization (ISO) and
is a registered agent of Sunrise Banks, N. A.

story:
About Marilyn Johnson & her Studio

I started The Marilyn Johnson Sewing Design Studio back in 1998 from the basement of my home. As far back as I can remember my fingers have itched to make things. My grandmother put the first threaded needle in my hands when I was about seven years old and taught me some simple embroidery stitches. Since then I have wanted to gobble up anything and everything to do with fabric and fashion.

 By 2002 I had outgrown my space at home and began seriously looking into moving to a commercial location. I have many people to thank, especially Dan Stacier and Ron Xifo, for steering me in the right direction, giving me heads up on available locations and sharing their wisdom with me. When I first arrived at Unit E at 154 Lafayette Avenue in Laurel, MD I looked into the grease covered auto repair shop that still had hoists and trucks in it and knew I had found a new home for my business.  Thanks to the skills and dedication of my husband and sons, we were able to remove the layers of grease and grime and created the potential for a place where my passion and I could continue to grow. I spent eleven great years in Unit E working toward my goals; I made it through the worst of the Great Recession and watched my kids grow and start families of their own, all the while growing my business and gaining a reputation of perfectionism and creative solutions with my clientele.

By 2013 my staff, my costume stock, and my client base had multiplied several times over their 2002 numbers. We were bursting at the seams, and in the hottest summer in recent memory, we really needed a space with air conditioning.  In order to make the next step to truly pamper (and not melt) our clientele, we needed more space.  We moved across the parking lot to Units K and J.

With all the additional space in the new studio, I was able to expand my business in several directions by making official the “Sewing School” so many had asked for as well as really developing a full-service costume closet of custom costumes and rentals for theater and re-enactors with a mascot or two thrown in. Unit K is the client side, where we pamper and fawn over our clients. Unit J is our costume closet, where we store our hundreds of costumes for all occasions.

However, the past few years have been challenging due to changes in the economy. We have our peak seasons (Spring: Bridal/Prom, Fall: Bridal/Halloween), and the in-between months of alterations as our bread and butter. This income alone is not always enough to cover the expenses of garment building and maintenance, let alone to allow us to take that next big leap. Now we need the capital to grow and bring in the costume clientele to match the level of our custom clientele.

What the Studio Needs & What You Get

We have a large closet of costumes for rent and we love it because it consists of rare, unique and vintage pieces, as well as complex costumes we have built in-house. However, this closet takes up a large portion of our studio and overhead, and we need the capital to advertise and market it effectively.

Our Studio rent is $3,000 a month and the past several months have proven difficult in making ends meet. We do not want to give up our costume closet, as it took 16 years to build, and it is a personal passion of mine to provide beautifully built, clean, and creative costumes for schools, theatre and dance troupes, film studios, and individual clients for theme parties, galas, Renaissance Festivals, Comic Con, and beyond. But storing these costumes takes up most of Unit J, which is half the studio and half the rent – a whopping $1,500 a month. While the new space and other changes to our look and staffing has created a thriving and robust climate for our alterations and custom work, our rentals are taking longer to pick up steam.

The main goal for funding is to cover the costs of maintaining the Costume Closet for the next year, which includes the rental fees and other overhead expenses for that part of the studio, cleaning costs, and material costs for any repairs needed.  We have recently implemented several new marketing tactics and slimmed down our operation as much as possible.  Now we need the time and capital to see it through.

Some Examples of our Costumes


The Impact

By supporting The Marilyn Johnson Sewing Design Studio, you are helping us keep our Costume Closet, which provides hundreds of pieces for theaters, film and dance companies, school productions, and special occasions. With your help, we will be able to pay the expenses without worry as we work on increasing our clientele.

Your support will give us the resources to re-group, evaluate, and implement our marketing techniques so we can consistently build revenue from the Costume Closet throughout the entire year, instead of in just a few peak seasons.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t make a donation, that’s okay! Please help spread the word about our Studio and our campaign. Tell your friends and family. Share on Social Media. Any bit of help is greatly appreciated.

story:
In just few seconds you can have the color you like !!

                                  


With just one bag you are getting basically 5 different options to choose from. You always have 3 colors with you anytime you are out.  You can flip the addition from the other side and automatically you have different bag!!!

What's really exiting about this bag is that you are saving a lot of space and the minimum that you can replace is another 5 bags.  Very accessible and easy for everyday use.



  



   


Benefits

One of the main reasons why this bag is awesome is that with the price of one bag you will have "5 different bags" and increase your saving account.

·  How many times you were struggling to match your heels and bag?


· How many times you were wondering which scarf and belt to wear with your bag?

· How many times you were wishing to have just one bag to solve all of this problems?



           

            


What is the only thing that ladies handbags are missing?

- Order!  
This handbag has pockets and space that will help you organize, put everything in place and give you fresher and tidier look inside! 

Two Special Shades holders on each side of the bag. No more wasting time to take your shades in and out from the bag for countless times while shopping!

                    


Addition for your color add-ons. Very simple and easy way to store your other "4 bags" in the locker and save plenty of room for other stuff. All you need to do is put a hanger on your addition!

                  


Now you don't have to transfer all your stuff from one bag to another just because you want to go in different style or outfit to work, or shopping.

  

             







         

                     


 

When will my M&V Handbag be shipped? 

After the Indiegogo campaign is over, we are going to finalize the products asap, which means by the end of October we are going to have everything set and ready for shipping. At the beginning of November we are going to start the shipping worldwide.

Is this handbag made of leather?

NO! We don't want to harm the living animals so that's why we chose our handbag to be artificial leather. The material that we use is really high quality.         

How can I choose color?

We have created perks with colors that are standard for both bags. We also made another perks where you can have 8 or 10 add-ons so you will have different combinations.

story:
Introducing the Accomplice™ and the Diplomat™

Four years after our successful Kickstarter campaign for the Minimalist™, we're excited to share the next two products in our Capsule family, the Accomplice and the Diplomat. 

The Challenge

Time and time again, we found our customers carrying more than the recommended number of cards in their Minimalists, or stuffing their pockets with loose receipts and stacks of business cards.

Our design challenge was to create a sophisticated wallet solution for people that simply need to carry more, but still want to keep a low-profile.

To address these occasions, we created the Accomplice and the Diplomat.

Want to carry more? Zip it up!

Zipper wallets have been around for a long time. They’re coveted for their ability to securely ‘lock in’ any and everything you want to carry in your wallet. But to our frustration, we couldn’t find any zip wallets that looked good AND worked well. Trust us. We looked.

Today, most of the options on the market are big and bulky, while others have a zip opening barely large enough to fit anything in, making them functionally unwieldy.

We’re proud to bring you the thinnest zip wallets ever made.

Key Features

 

The Accomplice

The Accomplice is a versatile cash, card, and sundry carrier crafted from premium full-grain Italian leathers, stitched with high-tenacity Serafil, lined in high-glide nylon, and secured with a bevelled YKK zipper. Engineered with the innovative interior access Cash$trap for discreet access to paper currency, secure card-hold, and optimized flexutility based on simple user-preference.

  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  

The Diplomat

The Diplomat is a versatile passport, ticket, visa, cash, card, and sundry carrier crafted from premium full-grain Italian leather, stitched with high-tenacity Serafil, lined in high-glide nylon, and secured with a bevelled YKK zipper. Engineered with the innovative interior access Cash$trap for discreet access to paper currency, secure angled-entry card-holds, and optimized flexutility based on simple user-preference.

 

 

 

 

 

About Capsule

 
Capsule designs forward thinking leather goods for your everyday essentials. Originators of the Minimalist, our premium wallets are distinguished by their low profile and high utility.
 
At Capsule, a foundation of our design ethos is to create products that reach beyond the simple axes of "Form and Function.” Any run-of-the-mill wallet at your local department store usually has basic “Functionality.” Some slots for cards and a main area for cash, but that’s it.
 
 
 
We coined the term “Flexutility™” to represent our philosophy that function should ALSO be useful. Function without utility is useless. Nearly every feature we design into our products is multi-purposable giving you the flexibility to use the wallet as you see fit.
 
 
All of our products are produced in partnership with one of the premier European manufacturers in the world. With 40+ years of experience crafting luxury leather goods for some of the finest brands in the world, our manufacturing process utilizes only premium materials and is evaluated against the highest standards of quality control.
 

Capsule Product Features

 

Leather Options

For the products in this campaign, we've selected three of our most popular leathers, sourced from the finest Italian tanneries.
 
Blackout - A smooth and buttery soft nappa cowhide leather.
Tanistry - A beautiful full vegetable tan cowhide leather sourced from the heart of Tuscany. This leather will age beautifully, like a broken-in baseball glove.
Blacktie - A coated and embossed leather. Selected for its durability and "like-new" characteristic even after extended use.
 

 

  

 

 

Thank You

Heartfelt and special thanks to the following individuals:
 
Jennifer and Liam Maher of the famed Energy Plan Creative (www.energyplancreative.com) for countless hours of priceless guidance and support. 
 
The crack video team at John Pangilinan (www.jpangilinan.com/) for bringing the ambitious brief to life and meeting an impossible deadline. 
 
The one and only Dave Buck (www.dananddave.com), for graciously lending his unique sleight-of-hand talents to the production. 
 
The growing Capsule team (Victor, Simona, Charlie) and countless friends and family who’ve provided unwavering support along the way.
 
And to our customers and fans for which none of this would be possible without your support.

Carry Forward, 
 
Robert
story_txt:
Introducing the Accomplice™ and the Diplomat™Four years after our successful Kickstarter campaign for the Minimalist™, we're excited to share the next two products in our Capsule family, the Accomplice and the Diplomat. 
 
Get Cash Back on the Projects You Love! The ChallengeTime and time again, we found our customers carrying more than the recommended number of cards in their Minimalists, or stuffing their pockets with loose receipts and stacks of business cards.Our design challenge was to create a sophisticated wallet solution for people that simply need to carry more, but still want to keep a low-profile.To address these occasions, we created the Accomplice and the Diplomat.Want to carry more? Zip it up!Zipper wallets have been around for a long time. They’re coveted for their ability to securely ‘lock in’ any and everything you want to carry in your wallet. But to our frustration, we couldn’t find any zip wallets that looked good AND worked well. Trust us. We looked.Today, most of the options on the market are big and bulky, while others have a zip opening barely large enough to fit anything in, making them functionally unwieldy.We’re proud to bring you the thinnest zip wallets ever made.Key Features  
 The AccompliceThe Accomplice is a versatile cash, card, and sundry carrier crafted from premium full-grain Italian leathers, stitched with high-tenacity Serafil, lined in high-glide nylon, and secured with a bevelled YKK zipper. Engineered with the innovative interior access Cash$trap for discreet access to paper currency, secure card-hold, and optimized flexutility based on simple user-preference.         From left to right: 20 Cards, 14 Cards + 20 Bills, 70 Bills   
 The DiplomatThe Diplomat is a versatile passport, ticket, visa, cash, card, and sundry carrier crafted from premium full-grain Italian leather, stitched with high-tenacity Serafil, lined in high-glide nylon, and secured with a bevelled YKK zipper. Get Your Project Funded Today! 

 

Thank You

Jennifer and Liam Maher of the famed Energy Plan Creative (www.energyplancreative.com) for countless hours of priceless guidance and support. 
 
The crack video team at John Pangilinan (www.jpangilinan.com/) for bringing the ambitious brief to life and meeting an impossible deadline. 
 
The one and only Dave Buck (www.dananddave.com), for graciously lending his unique sleight-of-hand talents to the production. 
 
The growing Capsule team (Victor, Simona, Charlie) and countless friends and family who’ve provided unwavering support along the way.

story:
To release or adjust the belt, just pinch the small tab under the buckle. It's like a giant zip tie for your waist - only more fun.


Like it or not - as you work, walk, eat, sleep, play - your waist size fluctuates, in and out a little each day. Unfortunately traditional belts only offer five - one inch spaced holes that rarely seem to line up with your actual waist size. The result > a poor fit.

Trakline belts, on the other hand, use a clever, concealed track that lets you adjust your belt size ¼” at a time with over 40 positions. The result > a perfect fit. 

Most traditional men's belts have holes that stretch and crease making them look awful. But Trakline belts don’t have any holes – so they retain their “like new” appearance even after a year or more of daily wear.

And our new Express buckles and smooth belts are interchangeable with ALL of our existing standard-sized (1.4" wide) Trakline fashion belts and buckles. 


 


 



We launched our first evolution of Trakline belts on Kickstarter in 2013. We were fortunate enough to attract over 4,000 generous backers and were on our way. Now we're back again to introduce our newest buckle style and smooth leather belts.

                                             < Customer Comments >

“I love my Trakline belt!  I show it off to everyone. Great product, so glad I became a backer!” - Mike Goodridge


“This is an amazing belt ! The quality is great and is now my favourite belt!” - Thurstan Johnstan

“Got my two belts and buckles and they're amazing. The quality is top-notch.” - Casus Belli

“I love the belt and the quality in manufacturing and design is evident in everything.” - Scott Burns

“Seriously, I can't get over how much I love this belt. I totally forget I'm wearing it because it's so comfortable.” - Thomas Ella


Karl Kozak:  Sales & Marketing
Mauro Bove:  Manufacturing & Quality Control
Steve Olson:  Product & Web Design

The three of us have been friends and business partners for over 12 years now. Here's a little of our background and relevant history. For the past 15 years Mauro has been in product manufacturing and quality control. As a result, he's manufactured a wide variety of high-quality retail products for some of America’s biggest retailers. Steve on the other hand, is an all-around talented designer, who's been crucial in creating our product designs, drawings and the website. My background has been in business management and sales. Over the past several decades, I've successfully launched, grown, managed and sold several companies. Together, the three of us make a great, motivated team that’s focused on creating and marketing great products. 

In 2015 we were issued a total of 4 patents on our unique Trakline belts. In addition, we have two more patents pending that we expect to issue within the next year. Why all the patents ? We’ve spent a lot of time and money perfecting our proprietary technology and we'd like to keep it that way. 



INSTAGRAM - Follow Us

                                 THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME & SUPPORT
                                  SHOP online >> http://www.KoreEssentials.com

© Copyright 2016 Kore Essentials, Inc.  Trakline Belt is a registered U.S. Trademark.  Trakline belts are Patented.
story_txt:
No more belt holes. Instead
a hidden track creates the best fitting, longest lasting,
best looking belt you’ll ever wear.  See
why MEN LOVE THEM…                         SHOP online  >> http://www.KoreEssentials.com 














NO MORE BELT HOLES.  Instead Trakline belts use a hidden, 10” track
sewn into the backside of the leather to create over 40+ size positions that let you adjust your belt in ¼”
increments. This means when you slide our belt around your waist - it locks at
your exact waist size creating a perfect fit every time you put it on. 

To release or
adjust the belt, just pinch the small tab under the buckle. It's like a giant zip tie for your waist - only more fun. 








                             SHOP online  >>  http://www.KoreEssentials.com Our Trakline
brand men's belts are 800% more adjustable than traditional belts, and 140% more adjustable
than other ratchet style belts. 


Like
it or not - as you work, walk, eat, sleep, play - your waist size fluctuates,
in and out a little each day. Unfortunately traditional belts only offer five -
one inch spaced holes that rarely seem to line up with your actual waist size.
The result > a poor fit.
Trakline
belts, on the other hand, use a clever, concealed track that lets you adjust
your belt size ¼” at a time with over 40 positions. The result > a perfect fit. 





Most traditional men's belts have holes that stretch and crease making them look awful. But Trakline belts don’t have any holes –
so they retain their “like new” appearance even after a year or more of daily wear. 
And our new Express buckles and smooth belts are interchangeable with ALL of our existing standard-sized (1.4" wide) Trakline fashion belts and buckles. 






 


















At Kore Essentials creating unique, quality products for men is what we do. So we take it seriously and strive to improve whenever possible. These unique, smooth belts (no stitching) are constructed of 100%
Top-Grain Leather. Top-Grain is the 2nd
layer of cowhide just under the exterior full-grain layer. The buckles
(2.25” x 1.5”) are a high-quality zinc alloy with a hard, scratch-resistant finish. And as always our products include a 30 day full money back
guarantee & 1 year warranty. 


 




 Our belts come in “One-Size” that
fits any waist from 24” up to 44”. When you receive your new belt, you snap the belt into the buckle and try it on first.
The belt should wrap around your waist from left to right and the tip should pass 2-3 inches beyond first pant loop. Any leather longer than that is "excess", that you can trim off. It’s easy and takes only
seconds using regular household scissors. To make it even easier, on the back of the leather we imprinted waist
size markings to guide you. In effect,
you’re trimming the belt to match your “size range”. Once completed, the track lets you adjust
your belt up to 5 inches in either direction – in or out - in tiny ¼”
increments.  This is the best fitting belt you’ll ever own.  




Sizing your belt.  First - try it on.  Belts fit from 24" to 44" waists. 
Flip the buckle over.

Open the receptacle (teeth) and release the belt. 

Use sharp household scissors to trim off the excess leather. 
Replace the belt, clamp down the receptacle and wear daily. 




In 2011 my wife bought me an expensive belt for my birthday.
Unfortunately, my waist was “in-between” the belt holes at the time. We’ve all been there. This time I boldly decided to poke a few holes of my own in the leather and “fix it”
myself. Bad idea. I completely ruined the belt. I learned several key lessons that day.
First – belt holes are bad.  Second, never puncture a gift from your wife.  


We launched our first evolution of Trakline belts on Kickstarter in 2013. We
were fortunate enough to attract over 4,000 generous backers and were on our
way. Now we're back again to introduce our newest buckle style and smooth leather belts. 

                                             < Customer Comments >“I love my Trakline belt!  I show it off to everyone. Great product, so glad I became a backer!” - Mike Goodridge

“This is an amazing belt ! The quality is great and is now my favourite belt!” - Thurstan Johnstan

“Got my two belts and buckles and they're amazing. The quality is top-notch.” - Casus Belli

“I love the belt and the quality in manufacturing and design is evident in everything.” - Scott Burns
“Seriously, I can't get over how much I love this belt. I totally forget I'm wearing it because it's so comfortable.” - Thomas Ella



Although we’ve been on Kickstarter and Indiegogo a combined 7 times before with great success, we’re still a small company and launching a new product requires a lot of resources and funds up front. This means we need your support to help pay for molds and enough starting inventory to keep the costs down. In return, we’d love to give you one of these fabulous new belts, or several if you like. Either way – we promise you’re going to love it. 










We plan to begin the first production run in mid March. Based on the factories estimate, this process
should take about 30-45 days to complete depending on volume. Once production is completed, we'll ship the
belts to our warehouse in San Diego, California (2-3 weeks) and then repackage
individual orders to ship out to contributors (2 weeks). So all in all, you should get your belt about 30 days after this campaign ends. 


We
launched our first Trakline men's belts back in 2013 with great. Today our
company is known as Kore Essentials and we pride ourselves in creating unique, high-quality accessories for men. If you’d like to see our entire collection of belts
and other accessories, or learn more about our company, visit us at  >>  http://www.KoreEssentials.com 

Karl Kozak:  Sales & MarketingMauro Bove:  Manufacturing & Quality ControlSteve Olson:  Product & Web Design
The three of us have been friends and
business partners for over 12 years now. Here's a little of our background and
relevant history. For the past 15 years Mauro has been in product manufacturing
and quality control. As a result, he's manufactured a wide variety of
high-quality retail products for some of America’s biggest retailers. Steve on
the other hand, is an all-around talented designer, who's been crucial in
creating our product designs, drawings and the website. My background has been
in business management and sales. Over the past several decades, I've
successfully launched, grown, managed and sold several companies. Together, the
three of us make a great, motivated team that’s focused on creating and marketing great
products. 
In 2015 we were issued a total of 4 patents on our unique Trakline belts. In
addition, we have two more patents pending that we expect to issue within the
next year. Why all the patents ? We’ve spent a lot of time and money perfecting our proprietary technology
and we'd like to keep it that way.  





FACEBOOK - Like Us






INSTAGRAM - Follow Us



                                 THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME & SUPPORT 


                                  SHOP online >> http://www.KoreEssentials.com 

© Copyright 2016 Kore Essentials, Inc.  Trakline
Belt is a registered U.S. Trademark.  Trakline belts are Patented.

story:
From the storm of ideas emerges a shape - an initial freehand sketch which captures the pure lines of the AIRSPEED. While examining the technical specifications of the design, we asked ourselves these questions: How will the watch be powered? How will it transmit stored energy? Which materials guarantee the level of precision, reliability and quality required over the long term? Technical considerations, ergonomic details and dial design are pondered down to the tiniest detail and coordinated with one another.

The sketch is then given volume by 3D rendering, followed by two working prototypes. The curved case design and all other materials are thoroughly tested and improved in durability, water and air pressure resistance, as well as an overall homogeny in appearance and finish.

 

The regulator complication first appeared in the late 17th century and was used by watchmakers for verifying the rates of their creations. For those unfamiliar, a regulator is a watch in which the second, minute and hour hands are separated into sub-dials. With the AIRSPEED, a traditional vertical layout is swapped for a more asymmetric design, resulting in an unexpectedly modern take on this vintage design.

 

 

The curved casing is made from Hesalite crystal, a robust, shatterproof material that has gone into space on many occasions. With Hesalite, smudges are hardly visible on the AIRSPEED. It even gives the dial a warmer look. You’ll notice that the dome-shaped crystal extends to the very edge– making the watch look more crystal than metal. This is more than an elegant design feature, as it slightly magnifies the dial elements for better legibility from all angles and lighting conditions.

For other reasons why we chose hesalite over mineral or sapphire crystal, please refer to the image below.

 

After carefully evaluating a number of options, we sensibly picked the Miyota 8219, an absolute tank of a ticker with an impeccable reputation since its debut in 1977. Beating to a frequency of 21,600 BPH / 3 Hz, Miyota has proven to be more accurate than most mechanical watches at 18,000 BPH / 2.5 Hz. The movement has 21 jewel to reduce friction and wear on moving parts, maintain temperature stability, and the ability to operate without lubrication, well above the 17 jewel average. Miyota also employs its own shock resistance technology called Parashock, making the watch more durable and perfect for multipurpose wear. With the massive 2-day / 45-hour power reserve, you do not need to constantly wind it. You can take it off on Friday and it will still be ticking on Sunday.

 

The markings on the dial and the hands are coated in in Super-LumiNova. A luminous dial and hands make it easy for you to check time at a glance, whether you’re in a movie or jetlagged in a dark hotel room. Luminance is only available on the pilot version of the AIRSPEED.

 

The beige dial is more business-casual than strictly formal. It is a great daily wearer, not looking too out of place with a pair of jeans.

We also offer two alternatives: Pilot S/S and Vintage Sport. Go for a more classic look with this Pilot S/S version. The black dial is now accented by a silvertone stainless steel frame.

Otherwise, you can pull of a sporty look with the Vintage Sport version. It comes in red and black hands against a beige dial. 


  • Case Diameter: 43.0 mm  
  • Case Thickness: 14.8 mm  
  • Lug Width: 20.0 mm  
  • Case Material: Hesalite Crystal  
  • Movement: Miyota Caliber 8219  
  • Dial: PVD Coating with Super-LumiNova (Pilot Ver. Only)  
  • Water Resistance: 3 ATM (30 m)

AIRSPEED offers a number of straps of different styles that are interchangeable, making it easy to navigate between all of your favorite combinations.  

Our Italian leather straps are well made and quite comfortable on your wrist with a reassuring stiffness, but pleasantly thin profile.

If you want to add a dash of playful colors, our lightweight nylon straps bring a pop of color to your look without overshadowing the rest of your outfit.

We also offer an AIRSPEED with Milanese Bracelet that features tiny interlinking pieces of metal which is in many ways similar to a jewellery bracelet. The Pilot AIRSPEED comes with a matching matt black stainless steel mesh strap while the Vintage AIRSPEED is fitted with a pair of silver stainless steel mesh strap.

 

A huge part of your experience when purchasing a watch is unpacking it from the box in which it arrives. We are always looking for ways to heighten the experience of purchasing a watch, and so we designed a beautiful presentation box. Within the box you'll find a user manual and a piece of polishing cloth.

pieces of metal which is in many ways similar to a jewellery bracelet. 
The Pilot AIRSPEED comes with a matching matt black stainless steel mesh
